form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. McConnell (for himself and Mr. Paul) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To exempt the aging process of distilled spirits from the production period for purposes of capitalization of interest costs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Advancing Growth in the Economy through Distilled Spirits Act or the AGED Spirits Act.

subsection.text: Section 263A(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (5), and
by inserting after paragraph (3) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Exemption for aging process of distilled spirits
paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the production period shall not include the aging period for distilled spirits (as described in section 5002(a)(8)).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to the production of distilled spirits that begins on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
